body: @joel-costigliola Hi, I am interested in this. Would you like to assign this to me?
@joel-costigliola Yes, Iâ€™ve done some work but I'm a little busy last two weeks and I'm really sorry for that. I was working on this just now and I'll finish this soon.

@joel-costigliola Hi, I'm confused about the second requirement(refactoring). Does it mean I need to create a new test class named `Assertions_sync_with_BDDAssumptions_WithAssertions_and_soft_assertions_variants_Test` as it describes?

thanks @HDreamer2.
you need to change `Assertions_sync_with_BDDAssumptions_Test` so that it has a parameterized tests as we did in `Assertions_sync_with_BDDAssumptions_WithAssertions_and_soft_assertions_variants_Test`, hope it's clearer.

@joel-costigliola Thanks, it's quite clearer and I've done most of the work including refactoring. But I still have some questions like the implementation of `assumeThatException`. Since there is no method like `assertThatExceptionOfType` whose argument is exceptionType, I tried to call `assumeThat(new Exception())` whose declaration is `public static <T extends Throwable> AbstractThrowableAssert<?, T> assumeThat(T actual)`. Is that a kind of reasonable implementation?
@HDreamer2 I think it would be nice to add `assumeThatExceptionOfType` and use it in the implementation of `assumeThatException`, `assumeThatRuntimeException` etc ...
